title: EUTHENIA
content:
EUTHENIA was the goddess or personified spirit (daimona) of prosperity and abundance. She and her
        three sisters--Eukleia (Good Repute), Philophrosyne
        (Welcome) and Eupheme (Acclaim)--were probably the goddesses known collectively as
        the younger Kharites (Charites). Her opposite number was Penia (Poverty).

HEPHAISTOS & AGLAIA
        (Orphic Rhapsodies Frag)

Other references not currently quoted here: Orphic Fragments, Inscriptiones Graecae 4.676.

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
